bibl.title: Telegram from Willard C. Rappleye to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952

div1.p: Rappleye has arranged for a representative of Columbia University Medical School to place wreaths in memory of alumni Lazear, Agramonte, and Sternberg at the Camp Lazear dedication. He thanks Hench for the suggestion.

div1.head: Telegram from Willard C. Rappleye to Philip Showalter Hench, November 24, 1952

div1.p:
YOUR LETTER REGARDING PHYSICIANS DAY IN CUBA RECEIVED TODAY
WE ARE ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT PROPOSAL AND GLAD TO FINANCE
WREATHS FOR CEREMONY IN HAVANA ON DECEMBER 3RD DOCTOR
RAIMUNDO DE CASTRO IS PRESIDENT OF COLUMBIA ALUMNI CLUB OF
CUBA AND PROFESSOR OF LEGAL MEDICINE UNIVERSITY OF HAVANA AM
ASKING HIM TO BE OUR REPRESENTATIVE AND TO GET IN TOUCH WITH
DOCTOR CESAR RODRIGUEZ EXPOSITO YOUR WHOLE PLAN A HAPPY
SUGGESTION LET ME KNOW IF WE CAN DO ANYTHING MORE TO HELP
REGRET THAT I CANNOT ATTEND PERSONALLY
div1.closer:
WARMEST GREETINGS= WILLARD C RAPPLEYE
MD DEAN COLLEGE OF PHYSICIANS AND
SURGEONS THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
